files.README.md:
# AI Studio Claude Code Plugin

AI Studio tools and workflows for Claude Code.

## Structure

```
ai-studio-cc-plugin/
├── .claude-plugin/
│   └── marketplace.json      # Plugin marketplace metadata
├── plugins/
│   └── ai-studio/
│       ├── .claude-plugin/
│       │   └── plugin.json   # Plugin manifest
│       ├── .mcp.json         # MCP server configuration
│       ├── .lsp.json         # LSP configuration
│       ├── commands/         # Command definitions
│       └── skills/           # Skill definitions
├── LICENSE
└── README.md
```

## For Users: Installation

### From GitHub (Recommended)

```bash
/plugin marketplace add freedom07/ai-studio-cc-plugin
/plugin install ai-studio@ai-studio-cc-plugin
```

### From Local Directory

```bash
git clone https://github.com/freedom07/ai-studio-cc-plugin.git
/plugin marketplace add ./ai-studio-cc-plugin
/plugin install ai-studio@ai-studio-cc-plugin
```

### Update Marketplace

To get the latest plugins:

```bash
/plugin marketplace update ai-studio-cc-plugin
```

## For Developers: Deployment

### Deploy to GitHub (Recommended)

1. **Create GitHub Repository**
   ```bash
   git init
   git add .
   git commit -m "Initial commit: ai-studio plugin"
   git remote add origin https://github.com/freedom07/ai-studio-cc-plugin.git
   git push -u origin main
   ```

2. **Users can add via**
   ```bash
   /plugin marketplace add freedom07/ai-studio-cc-plugin
   ```

### Deploy to Other Git Services

GitLab, Bitbucket, or self-hosted Git servers also work:

```bash
# Push to GitLab
git remote add origin https://gitlab.com/freedom07/ai-studio-cc-plugin.git
git push -u origin main

# Users add via full URL
/plugin marketplace add https://gitlab.com/freedom07/ai-studio-cc-plugin.git
```

### Test Locally Before Deployment

```bash
# Validate marketplace structure
/plugin validate .

# Test locally
/plugin marketplace add ./ai-studio-cc-plugin
/plugin install ai-studio@ai-studio-cc-plugin
```

## Updating Deployed Marketplace

### Push Updates

1. **Make changes** to plugins (commands, skills, etc.)

2. **Update version** in `plugins/ai-studio/.claude-plugin/plugin.json`:
   ```json
   {
     "name": "ai-studio",
     "version": "1.1.0",
     "description": "AI Studio tools and workflows"
   }
   ```

3. **Commit and push**
   ```bash
   git add .
   git commit -m "Update: add new feature"
   git push
   ```

4. **Users update via**
   ```bash
   /plugin marketplace update ai-studio-cc-plugin
   ```

## Team Configuration

To auto-install for team members, add to `.claude/settings.json` in your project:

```json
{
  "extraKnownMarketplaces": {
    "ai-studio-cc-plugin": {
      "source": {
        "source": "github",
        "repo": "freedom07/ai-studio-cc-plugin"
      }
    }
  },
  "enabledPlugins": {
    "ai-studio@ai-studio-cc-plugin": true
  }
}
```

## Adding New Plugins

To add another plugin to this marketplace:

1. **Create plugin directory**
   ```bash
   mkdir -p plugins/new-plugin/.claude-plugin
   mkdir -p plugins/new-plugin/commands
   mkdir -p plugins/new-plugin/skills
   ```

2. **Create plugin manifest** (`plugins/new-plugin/.claude-plugin/plugin.json`)
   ```json
   {
     "name": "new-plugin",
     "version": "1.0.0",
     "description": "Description of new plugin"
   }
   ```

3. **Update marketplace.json** (`.claude-plugin/marketplace.json`)
   ```json
   {
     "plugins": [
       {
         "name": "ai-studio",
         "source": "./plugins/ai-studio",
         "description": "AI Studio tools and workflows",
         "version": "1.0.0"
       },
       {
         "name": "new-plugin",
         "source": "./plugins/new-plugin",
         "description": "Description of new plugin",
         "version": "1.0.0"
       }
     ]
   }
   ```

## Usage

After installation, AI Studio tools will be available in your Claude Code session.

### Commands

Commands are defined in `plugins/ai-studio/commands/` directory as Markdown files.

### Skills

Skills are defined in `plugins/ai-studio/skills/` directory.

## License
